siteMeta.title: Steel Documentation
siteMeta.description: Full documentation for Steel - the open-source headless browser API for AI agents. Here you'll find all the guides, concepts, and API reference for developing with Steel.

sidebar.name: Intro to Steel
sidebar.description: Humans use Chrome, Agents use Steel.

children.name: Overview
children.description: Manage fleets of browser sessions with ease.

children.name: Quickstart
children.description: Get up a running with your first Steel Session in a few minutes.

children.name: Session Lifecycle
children.description: Learn how to start and release browser sessions programatically.

children.name: Multi-region
children.description: Control where your Steel browser sessions are hosted for optimal performance and latency.

children.name: Connect with Puppeteer
children.description: Drive a Steel session with Puppeteer via WebSocket connection.

children.name: Connect with Playwright (Node)
children.description: Drive a Steel session with Playwright via WebSocket connection.

children.name: Connect with Playwright (Python)
children.description: Drive a Steel session with Playwright-python via WebSocket connection

children.name: Connect with Selenium
children.description: How to drive and connect to Steel browser sessions with Selenium.

children.name: Embed Session Recordings
children.description: How to access recordings of past browser sessions and display them within your app

children.name: View and Embed Live Sessions
children.description: How to embed and share live browser sessions in your applications

children.name: Implement Human-in-the-Loop Controls
children.description: How to let users take control of Steel browser sessions

children.name: Reusing Contexts & Auth
children.description: How to Reuse Authentication Across Steel Sessions

children.name: Quickstart
children.description: A step-by-step guide to connecting Steel with Browser-use.

children.name: Steel Playground
children.description: An interactive code execution environment for testing Steel automations.
